question: A friend has written to you asking for advice about a problem at work. You have had a similar problem in the past.Write a reply to your friend. In your letter:• tell your friend you understand the problem• explain what happened to you in the past• suggest possible solutions to the problem
text: I am writing concerning your difficulties with the latest release of navigation maps. As you know, I was preparing maps for Garmin devices over the course of 3 years. That is why I am completely aware ofwhat kind of problem may occur during compilation and how to tackle them.

In fact, I had a problem similar to yours, when I was doing a map product compilation in July and there was an error related to restrictions, where mentioned in the restriction links do not share a common vertex.

Thus, the first thing to do is to find a log file in a compilation folder. In the log file, you can find a description of all errors, which were met. Secondly, look for a list of link IDs in the file that are unique identifiers of problematic links and then open the map and use the “SQL-search” option in order to find links and fix the restriction. After all these operations, launch the compilation again.
If you have any other questions, do not hesitate to write to me again.
